inputs.name: source
inputs.label: Source Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the base directory for all source globbing patterns.

inputs.name: target
inputs.label: Target Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the directory to which ClickOnce packages will be published. If a relative path is specified, it will be relative to the Source directory. This directory will be automatically excluded from all source globbing patterns.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the version of the deployment. This need not be (and usually isn't) the same as the version of the application. Must be a dotted version number with 1 to 4 elements, each less than 63356. If not specified, the version number of the EntryPoint is used.

inputs.name: targetFramework
inputs.label: Target Framework
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the target framework of the application.

inputs.name: launchMode
inputs.label: Launch Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether the application can be launched from the Start menu, from a URL, or both. Also allows browser-hosted deployments (Internet Explorer only).

options.both: Launchable from Start menu or a URL

inputs.name: createDesktopShortcut
inputs.label: Create Desktop Shortcut
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether a shortcut to the application should be added to the user's desktop.

inputs.name: entryPoint
inputs.label: Entry Point
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the application assembly that starts when the application is run. Must be an .exe file. If this is not a .Net Framework assembly, a bootstrapper must be used via the UseBootstrapper option. If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for .exe files. If exactly one is found, it will be assigned to be the entry point.

inputs.name: iconFile
inputs.label: Icon File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the application icon file. This is used for the Start Menu and Add/Remove Programs dialog. Must be an .ico file. If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for .ico files. If exactly one is found it is used; othewise, a default icon is used.

inputs.name: assemblies
inputs.label: Assemblies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match assemblies to be included. Will only consider managed assemblies, hence a pattern of *.dll will exclude native libraries.

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match non-assembly files to be included.

inputs.name: dataFiles
inputs.label: Data Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a colon-separated list of globbing patterns to match data files to be included. These files are considered mutable, and can be migrated between application versions.
